pull.title: wallet: finish addressbook encapsulation and simplify addressbook migration
pull.body:
Decoupled the initial commits from #25620 and went further over few other points.

1) Finish #25337 goal of encapsulate the addressbook code into the wallet class.
2) Code improvements to `CWallet::DelAddressBook` and `Wallet::SetAddrBookWithDB` methods.
3) DB batch operations and flow simplification for the address book migration process.
4) Expanded coverage for address book migration process.

This will also allow decoupling the address book dependency on the walletâ€™s main mutex for reading. RPC commands such `getaddressbylabel` and similars will be able to run `cs_wallet` lock free.

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#27286](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27286) (wallet: Keep track of the wallet's own transaction outputs in memory by achow101)
* [#26740](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26740) (wallet: Migrate wallets that are not in a wallet dir by achow101)
* [#24914](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24914) (wallet: Load database records in a particular order by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Approach ACK.
I will review soon.

Thanks @rserranon.

> why not encapsulate the other calls to wallet->m_address_book[addr_pair.first].purpose = purpose ?

Good catch. I did this changes prior the wallet migration PR merge. Will add those too and make the addressbook member private so we don't keep adding more in the future.

Updated per feedback. Now we no longer access the wallet's addressbook member externally.

Plus, improvements to the address book migration process:
1) Fixed a bug where we don't copy the "send" records to all the wallets.
2) Have re-written the process with no code duplication.
3) Batched db writes so the disk dump is done all at once.

tAck
* unit tests
* functional tests
* qt & bitcoin-cli manual tests
tested ACK, both unit and functional tests.

Approach ACK.
I'll perform some testing soon.

tested ACK.
On the code review, went thru the different commits of the PR.
Performed manual testing using `bitcoin-qt`.

Rebased, conflicts solved.
Plus, per https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26761#discussion_r1134636537 request, added coverage for wallet address book migration process.

wallet: clean redundancies in DelAddressBook

1) Call IsMine only once (instead of two).
2) Encode destination only once (instead of three).
3) Don't remove the entry from the map if db write failed.
4) Notify GUI only if removal succeeded

comments.body: Nit: Shouldn't be better to use the capital B in `LoadAddrBookEntryLablel` and `LoadAddrBookEntryPurpose` as in `GetAddrBookSize` and `ListAddrBookAddreses` ?

I prefer the current code, it's more readable.
The curly braces initializer is primarily useful to prevent narrowing (which is the implicit conversion of arithmetic values). Here, there is no loss of accuracy, we are simply initializing a boolean from a logical statement.
Thanks but same as above, I prefer current code as it's more readable and there is no possible narrowing issue here.
